intro: Centropogon espinosanus, commonly known as the Spiny Centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
